default.shortDescription: Integrate Microsoft 365 usage reporting into your organization's existing reporting solution
descriptionParagraphs: Adaptive Cards are platform-agnostic snippets of UI, authored in JSON, that apps and services can openly exchange.

When delivered to a specific app, the JSON is transformed into native UI that automatically adapts to its surroundings. They help design and integrate light-weight UI for all major platforms and frameworks.

detailItemCategories.name: Scenarios
detailItemCategories.description: What could you use Adaptive Cards for?

items.name: Notify users
items.description: Particularly if you provide an interactive card for users to take additional information.

items.name: Collect feedback
items.description: Feedback scenarios like polls and surveys.

items.name: Interactions
items.description: Interactions that can be resolved in a single request/response cycle, where the results are useful for multiple members of the conversation.

items.name: Social/fun bots
items.description: Get an awesome cat image, randomly pick a winner, etc.

items.name: One-to-one chat
items.description: Enable incredibly diverse workloads. Q&A bots, bots that initiate workflows in other systems, bots that tell jokes, and bots that take notes are just a few examples.

items.description: Adaptive Cards are a great fit for Bots. They let you author a card once and have it render beautifully inside multiple apps, like Microsoft Teams, your own website, and more.

items.name: Adaptive Cards for Outlook Actionable Message Developers
items.description: Whether you are filling out a survey, approving an expense report, or updating a CRM sales opportunity, Actionable Messages enable you to take quick actions right from within Outlook. Developers can now embed Adaptive Cards in their emails or notifications, elevating user engagement with their services and increasing organizational productivity.
